segment.source: Enable .NET Framework 3.5 by using Windows PowerShell
segment.target: Enable .NET Framework 3.5 by using Windows PowerShell

segment.source: Enable .NET Framework 3.5 by using Windows PowerShell
segment.target: Enable .NET Framework 3.5 by using Windows PowerShell

segment.source: Enable .NET Framework 3.5 by using Windows PowerShell
segment.target: Enable .NET Framework 3.5 by using Windows PowerShell

segment.source: For a Windows Server® 2012 core installation that is not connected to the Internet, you can use Windows PowerShell to add .NET Framework 3.5 and provide access to the sourcessxs folder on the installation media.
segment.target: For a Windows Server® 2012 core installation that is not connected to the Internet, you can use Windows PowerShell to add .NET Framework 3.5 and provide access to the sourcessxs folder on the installation media.

segment.source: The sourcessxs folder can be copied to network share (for example, networksharesxs) to make it easily accessible to multiple computers.
segment.target: The sourcessxs folder can be copied to network share (for example, networksharesxs) to make it easily accessible to multiple computers.

segment.source: The target computer account DOMAINSERVERNAME$ must have at least read access to the network share.
segment.target: The target computer account DOMAINSERVERNAME$ must have at least read access to the network share.

segment.source: Requirements
segment.target: Requirements

segment.source: Windows Server 2012
segment.target: Windows Server 2012

segment.source: Installation media
segment.target: Installation media

segment.source: Administrator user rights.
segment.target: Administrator user rights.

segment.source: The current user must be a member of the local Administrators group to add or remove Windows features.
segment.target: The current user must be a member of the local Administrators group to add or remove Windows features.

segment.source: Target Computers might need network access and rights to use either alternate sources or an Internet connection to use Windows Update.
segment.target: Target Computers might need network access and rights to use either alternate sources or an Internet connection to use Windows Update.

segment.source: Steps
segment.target: Steps

segment.source: Start Windows PowerShell in the Administrator Command Prompt by typing:
segment.target: Start Windows PowerShell in the Administrator Command Prompt by typing:

segment.source: To install .NET Framework 3.5 from installation media located on a network share, use the following command:
segment.target: To install .NET Framework 3.5 from installation media located on a network share, use the following command:

segment.source: Where networksharesxs is the location of the source files.
segment.target: Where networksharesxs is the location of the source files.

segment.source: For more information about the Install-WindowsFeature cmdlet, see Install-WindowsFeature.
segment.target: For more information about the Install-WindowsFeature cmdlet, see Install-WindowsFeature.

segment.target: To verify installation, run the following command:

segment.source: The Install State column should show Installed for the .NET Framework 3.5 (includes .NET 2.0 and 3.0) feature.
segment.target: The Install State column should show Installed for the .NET Framework 3.5 (includes .NET 2.0 and 3.0) feature.
